tool_description:
Factual knowledge graph to query the context of topics and search for connections in between of topics.
Each topic is paired and synced with English Wikipedia articles.
name: factual knowledge graph - wikipedia
title: factual knowledge graph - wikipedia

api_list.name: Neighbors
api_list.description: Neighbors - Return a list of neighbors sorted by relative rank.

required_parameters.name: offset
required_parameters.description: Skip first {offset} neighbors for context related to parent {_id}

required_parameters.name: limit
required_parameters.description: Max Number of neighbors related to parent {_id}

api_list.name: API - Base endpoint
api_list.description: Welcoming message with contact details to developer.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://_next-factual-knowledge-graph-wikipedia-v1.p.rapidapi.com/"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "_next-factual-knowledge-graph-wikipedia-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://_next-factual-knowledge-graph-wikipedia-v1.p.rapidapi.com/"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "_next-factual-knowledge-graph-wikipedia-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Search
api_list.description: Search (fuzzy) function. Based on Wikimedia API, returned topics are mapped to entities in factual knowledge graph.

required_parameters.name: q
required_parameters.description: Keywords to query. Keywords identify topics' name.

api_list.name: Context between multiple entities
api_list.description: Return graph of connections between a set of topics. Max number of topics is 5.

required_parameters.name: _id
required_parameters.description: ID of first entity to query, return a sub-graph of entities IDs in path URL

optional_parameters.name: _second
optional_parameters.description: ID of a second entity to query

optional_parameters.name: _n-th
optional_parameters.description: ID of a n-th entity to query. Response is restricted to max 5 entities' IDs in path URL

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://_next-factual-knowledge-graph-wikipedia-v1.p.rapidapi.com/insight/4xJWNMLgg2aL16y9/PAyD8rYKqxEM47Vk/59v4aQmEBlkayeGZ/"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "_next-factual-knowledge-graph-wikipedia-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://_next-factual-knowledge-graph-wikipedia-v1.p.rapidapi.com/insight/{id}/{second}/{n_th}/"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "_next-factual-knowledge-graph-wikipedia-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Context of a topic
api_list.description: Return insights about a topic. Insight is a sub-graph of first neighbours related to a parent {_id}.

required_parameters.name: _id
required_parameters.description: Return the context of an entity as a subgraph of 6 neighbours for each entity's neighbour

import requests

url = "https://_next-factual-knowledge-graph-wikipedia-v1.p.rapidapi.com/insight/{id}/"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",

        }

print(response.json())
